title: Provenance, Citations, and the Trust Engine
core_principles: Trust is built from provenance signals, not persuasion.
Version tags create immutable truth snapshots.
Changelogs and attestations create governance for truth.
Citations enforce honesty and reduce hallucination.
trust_signals: Citations with source paths and versions
governance_implications: Version bumps must be documented in CHANGELOG.md.
Agent outputs should cite sources and versions.
agent_requirements: Always cite canon paths when possible.
If information is missing: respond 'Not found in canon.'
Label interpretive statements as commentary, not executable truth.
schema_impact: Add schema for attestation log entries.
Add schema for citation metadata in agent outputs.
